title: Grenfell is an example of Tick-box Britain, where courage and common sense go to die
text:
Sergeant Stevie Bull sounded almost apologetic describing the daring deed that won her the Emergency Services Award at The Pride of Britain ceremony on Monday night.

Twenty-eight-year-old Sgt Bull was at University College Hospital London on a routine call when she stepped around an eerily silent group of people and saw a man pointing a gun at a nurse. With security staff mistakenly heading the other way, Sgt Bull – she was a PC at the time, but has since been promoted – found herself facing the gunman alone.

“We’re trained to run away from firearms because I was an unarmed officer,” she explained. “[But] I was so close to him that it was fight or flight mode and I just went for him. I tried...
